title: Veterinary Oncology Market Shares, Competition and Trends Analysis 2025-2030: Discover the Impact of Advanced Therapies and Digital Tools
description: The veterinary oncology market is evolving with opportunities in advanced diagnostics, immunotherapy, telemedicine, and tailored regional strategies. Rising pet ownership and technological integration drive growth, urging stakeholders to innovate in response to shifting clinical and regulatory demands. Veterinary Oncology Market Veterinary Oncology Market Dublin, Sept. 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The "Veterinary Oncology Market by Animal Type (Canine, Equine, Exotic Pets), Treatment Mode (Chemo
content:
The veterinary oncology market is evolving with opportunities in advanced diagnostics, immunotherapy, telemedicine, and tailored regional strategies. Rising pet ownership and technological integration drive growth, urging stakeholders to innovate in response to shifting clinical and regulatory demands.

Dublin, Sept. 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The "Veterinary Oncology Market by Animal Type (Canine, Equine, Exotic Pets), Treatment Mode (Chemotherapy, Immunotherapy, Radiotherapy), Cancer Type, Mode of Administration, End User - Global Forecast 2025-2030" report has been added to ResearchAndMarkets.com's offering.

The veterinary oncology market is undergoing significant transformation, driven by technological advances, evolving clinical demand, and the integration of personalized care solutions for companion animals. For senior decision-makers across the animal health sector, staying ahead of these developments is now essential to maintaining competitiveness and delivering value throughout the care continuum.

The Veterinary Oncology Market grew from USD 1.61 billion in 2024 to USD 1.84 billion in 2025. It is expected to continue growing at a CAGR of 14.01%, reaching USD 3.55 billion by 2030. Market momentum is shaped by rising pet ownership, increasing disposable incomes, and demand for advanced cancer treatment in veterinary medicine. Companies and institutions across the globe are rapidly investing in innovative therapies, digital tools, and diagnostics, responding to the evolving clinical landscape and shifting regulatory needs.
• Regions Covered: Americas (United States, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Argentina), Europe, Middle East & Africa (including United Kingdom, Germany, France, South Africa, and more), Asia-Pacific (including China, India, Japan, Australia, South Korea, Indonesia, among others)
• Core Players Analyzed: AB Science SA, Anivive Lifesciences, Ardent Animal Health LLC, Boehringer Ingelheim International GmbH, Ceva Sante Animale SA, Covetrus Inc., Elanco Animal Health Incorporated, ELIAS Animal Health, Fidocure, IDEXX Laboratories Inc., Karyopharm Therapeutics Inc., Leroy Biotech SAS, Merck KGaA, Morphogenesis Inc., Nippon Zenyaku Kogyo Co. Ltd., PetCure Oncology LLC, PharmAust Limited, Rhizen Pharmaceuticals AG, Torigen Pharmaceuticals Inc., Varian Medical Systems Inc., Vetco Pharmaceuticals Inc., VetDC Inc., Virbac SA, VolitionRx Limited, Zoetis Inc.
summary: The Veterinary Oncology Market is evolving with opportunities in advanced diagnostics, immunotherapy, telemedicine, and tailored regional strategies. The market is expected to grow at a CAGR of 14.01%, reaching USD 3.55 billion by 2030. This growth is driven by rising pet ownership, increasing disposable incomes, and demand for advanced cancer treatment in veterinary medicine. Companies are investing in innovative therapies and digital tools, responding to shifting clinical and regulatory needs. The report also details the impact of advanced Therapies and Digital Tools on the global veterinary oncology market.
shortSummary: The veterinary oncology market is rapidly evolving due to rising pet ownership, evolving clinical demands, and personalized care solutions for animals.

argos_summary: The veterinary oncology market is projected to grow from USD 1.61 billion in 2024 to USD 3.55 billion by 2030, driven by rising pet ownership, higher disposable incomes, and demand for advanced therapies. Key growth drivers include advanced diagnostics, immunotherapy, radiotherapy, telemedicine, and digital tools that enable personalized care. The market is expanding across the Americas, Europe, Middle East & Africa, and Asia‑Pacific, with major players investing heavily in innovative treatments and regulatory compliance. This shift underscores the need for stakeholders to innovate to maintain competitiveness and deliver value throughout the care continuum.
